title: This Stroke font... not beamie
content:
I’m looking for this font... used by Non-format in Wire magzine as well. It’s named Strokes, but goggle doesn’t come up with any results.

I have attached the pix, It’s the word “Expo”. Any ideas?  
Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203147/http:/typophile.com/files/1_27.jpg) | 197.99 KB |

 [‹ Small Capital Eszett?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203147/http:/typophile.com/node/48746 "Go to previous forum topic") [typo/design events in London 1st-8th November '08? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203147/http:/typophile.com/node/50210 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Rebelone

comments.content: Looks like Prisma by Rudolf Koch, one of the many variants of Kabel (1928–31). It was once part of Letraset dry-transfer catalogue, but I don’t know where it’s gone since.

Great Thanks Celeste!!! From Prisma, i was able to google and find Regalis (Similar to Letraset Strokes) and finally leading to Gau Exposition. Here’s what i have done with it!

Cheers!  
Pat

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203147im_/http:/typophile.com/files/plastic_3543.jpg)
